title: Last activity you solved few questions. In this activity we give you some questions on Experimental Debugging, try to answer those questions

questions.questionText: The difference between programming and debugging is:

options.option: programming is the process of writing and gradually debugging a program until it does what you want.
options.feedback: Correct! Programming is the writing of the source code and debugging is the process of finding and correcting all the errors within the program until it is correct.

options.option: programming is creative and debugging is routine.
options.feedback: Incorrect. Programming can be creative, but it also follows a process and debugging can involve creativity in how you find the errors.

options.option: programming is fun and debugging is work.
options.feedback: Incorrect. Some people think that debugging is actually more fun than programming (they usually become good software testers). Debugging is much like solving puzzles, which some people think is fun!

options.option: there is no difference between them.
options.feedback: Incorrect. You cannot debug without first having a program, meaning that someone had to do the programming first.
